Summary: low big brite star looking object hovering stationary and then slow moving west
divs: Sighting DetailsFeb 3rd 2007 about 6:30pm..on the way home from Dinner in south Denver was driving east toward Aurora Colorado..seen a really big brite star looking object pretty low in the sky but too low to be a star briter than any stars in the sky too and looked to be sitting stationary and not moving..as i finally got home the object was pretty far west from where i was at..but could still see it easily with the naked eye..and got to observe it with my binoculars once home..looked to be almost dimond shaped from what i could tell but at times almost looked to change shape or dim..it was brite and almost looked to be orangish in color i guess while looking at it through the binoculars..and still looked to be stationary went back inside to look for my camcorder to try to tape the object but the battery was dead so went beck out to watch the object that seemed to look lower than before.. as i was watching it it looked to dim and almost flicker out and totally disappear..was crazy to see a object so big and brite just disappear then about 3-5 mins later the object flickerd back on and seemed to reappear in the same spot and a few small planes or jets seemed to fly close to the object as if they were observing it too and it seemed to slowly move west farther away from my direction..but so slow that you could hardly tell it was moving then once again seemed to flicker out and disappear again but never return by that time it was about 7pm.
trends: There have been 185 other sightings in Denver
There were no other sightings in Denver on or around February 3rd 2007
